channel.title: Spawning NPCs
channel.description:
Hey Guys,Im having trouble spawning NPCs..
I know the command is ::npc (no.)
But I am using a stripped down server source (BigApple),and it barely has anything in it(just what I need :P)
What can I do?
Do I have to add a command to client.java to spawn npcs?
any Ideas?
Cheers :)

item.title: Spawning NPCs
item.dc:creator: @xxlukexx xxlukexx
item.description:
@xxlukexx wrote:

there is a command but its for objects but, juse use autospawn, if you dont like the file then dont make a server.

Read full topic

item.title: Spawning NPCs
item.dc:creator: @joester joester
item.description:
@joester wrote:

[quote=“spreeman, post:3, topic:275723”]Because it’s it takes more time…can’t I make a npc spawning command in client.java??

Can you give me the write up if you know it?

Thanks :)[/quote]
Give me a npc give me a location and I will add one for you

Read full topic

item.title: Spawning NPCs
item.dc:creator: @newb_pk3r newb pk3r
item.description:
@newb_pk3r wrote:

[quote=“King Lingerz, post:6, topic:275723”][quote author=newb pk3r link=topic=364207.msg2764920#msg2764920 date=1240751314]
You can NOT use client.java for npc spawning. You need to use autospawn.cfg.
::npc does not make it come back you need to respawn it if you wanted it back.
[/quote]

I think he wants it to be temporary.[/quote]

He can always remove the code from the autospawn.cfg.

Read full topic

item.title: Spawning NPCs
item.dc:creator: @joester joester
item.description:
@joester wrote:

Simply Open Autospawn.cfg in notepad.
copy a line of coding e.g.

spawn = 1	3213	2801	0	0	0	0	0	2

Explaining that for you.
spawn:- giving the instance of spawning a npc.
= 1:- 1 is the ID of a NPC. In this case a man.
3213 2801:- They are the X and Y co’ords of the locations.
0 0 0 0 0 2:- The 0’s are the range of the walking say if you wanted him to walk left and right make it: 3213 2801 3214 2801 - That will make him take 1 pace left or right can’t remember :S.
The 2 in the code is the walk type. E.g. If you wan’t him to be stationary you would have it as walk type 1…

I really hope I helped. I’m kind of a newbie round here so

Read full topic
